title: Spaghetti Squash Pizza
directions: Preheat oven to 400ÂºF. Line a baking sheet with foil.
Cut squash in half lengthwise, and scoop out seeds. Place squash on baking sheet, cut side down. Cook for 20-25 minutes, until skin gives a bit when touched. Let cool.
When squash is cool enough to work with, scrape the flesh into a large bowl.
Meanwhile, heat coconut oil in a pan over medium heat. Add onions to the pan, and cook until fragrant. Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
Season with garlic powder, oregano, salt, and pepper. Add tomato sauce, and cook for an additional 2 minutes.

Combine beef/sauce mixture and spaghetti squash, and mix well. Add beaten eggs, and mix until eggs are no longer visible. Move the entire mixture to a baking dish. Bake for one hour, until mixture is set and top is golden.
ingredients: 1 tsp. coconut oil, raw, extra-virgin, organic
1 lbs. beef, ground, free-range or grass-fed, organic
1 tsp. sea salt, unrefined and pure
